intro: Phalacroloma septentrionale, commonly known as the northern phalacroloma, is a rare and specialized plant species found in specific high-altitude regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
